rounds.event: Charles Curtis of Kansas becomes the first Native American U.S. Senator.
The first Melodifestivalen is held at Cirkus in Stockholm, Sweden.
deaths: Pauline Smith, South African novelist, short story writer, memoirist and playwright

rounds.event: COVID-19 pandemic: The Trump administration establishes the White House Coronavirus Task Force under Secretary of Health and Human Services Alex Azar.
World War II: In Bologna, Italy, the Anatomical theatre of the Archiginnasio is completely destroyed in an air-raid.
deaths: William Allen White, American journalist and author

rounds.event: President Jacques Chirac announces a "definitive end" to French nuclear weapons testing.
